info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Mineral and southwestern Sanders Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thompson Falls to 9 miles northeast of De Borgia to near Superior. Movement was west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Haugan, De Borgia, St. Regis, Saltese, Keystone, East Portal and Taft. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 0 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
